timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: So to clarify, I think we should keep them warn. If you don't want these log messages every time (bad UX), you need to do something about it thus the warn.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
@loicmathieu suggested the warning was too strong (thinking something was wrong). As you and I discussed, I made it a warning to begin with because the behavior can be unexpected (in terms of metrics being emitted).
I'm reconsidering. ;) I'll drop this commit, I think.
replies.author: ebullient

replies.bodyText:
Warning means something went wrong but we recover from this.
If I use open metrics, as per the spec I must add the two annotations to have the two metrics.
For interoperability concerns keeping the two annotations is a valid choice.
So this message is an information that micrometer is compatible with open metrics but didn't follow the spec.
I would change it to debug level after a second thinking.
But I'm ok to keep warning it you didn't agree with the way I see this :)
